I spend the majority of my free time working on personal programming projects. I also enjoy teaching others what I have learned when the opportunity presents itself. I am most familiar with working in a Java environment but, I am a quick learner and would be a valuable addition to any development team.

Personal Project   |   July 2014 - Present

Grown Local is a farmer's market locator that I develop in my free time. It is available as a web app and on Android devices via Google Play. The website was built using HTML/CSS & Javascript. The Android app is built using Java and Android Studio and is compatible with devices running Android 2.3.3 and above. I currently make use of the USDA's farmer's market directory API as the data source. I am working on building my own API using Hibernate and Spring with a MySQL database backend. The MySQL database is running on a Digital Ocean VPS running Debian Linux and was modeled and built using MySQL Workbench.

grownlocal.us

Personal Project   |   June 2013 - February 2014

Myco Web Design started as project in college for a web technology course. After the project was finished I teamed up with a friend to start a business around the idea. We ended up creating websites for a few of the local businesses while we were in school. We are managing those websites still today.

Winona Kombat

Skills Used

  • C++
  • OpenGL
  • Xcode
  • 2D Graphics
  • Photoshop

School Project   |   Junior Year   |   Computer Graphics

Winona Kombat was a project for a computer graphics class my junior year of college. It was a two player fighting game that drew inspiration from the classic Mortal Kombat series. It was developed over the course of half a semester. This project was my first experice using C++ and OpenGL. This was also my first attempt at making a game with out the use of framework or game engine. The two "characters" in the game are myself and a friend. We took video of ourselves in front of a blue screen and created a sprite sheet of all our moves. I learned a lot of what not to do while making a game working on this project. For instance I learned not use a while loop as your game loop. The video below shows the final version of the game. As you may notice the game is running slow. This was due to the screen capture software reducing the speed at which the game loop ran. Overall the project was a success and a huge learning experience.
